meanings.definition: A written guarantee promising to repair or replace a product if it is faulty.
meanings.sent1: The warranty on my phone covers any defects for a year.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the warranty before purchasing the laptop.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my friendship came with a warranty for unlimited laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a warranty against any sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The warranty was like a shield, protecting me from unexpected expenses.

meanings.definition: Confidence in the truth or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: His warranty in the weather forecast proved right again.
meanings.sent2: She had full warranty in her friend's ability to keep a secret.
meanings.sent3: I have more warranty in my lucky socks than in my study habits.
meanings.sent4: The old sailor's stories carried a warranty of authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The detective's intuition was a warranty for solving the case.
